node.title: 'Staggering': UK braces for more COVID-19 cases as it hits new daily record
node.alt: A person wearing a protective face masks walks past Big Ben.
node.description: More than 78,000 new daily cases in the UK are recorded as the head of the UK Health Security Agency warns there could be a "staggering" amount of new COVID-19 cases in the country over the next few days
node.content:
["The UK has set a new daily record of COVID-19 cases as the highly transmissible Omicron variant continues to sweep across the country.", "It comes as the head of the UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) warned there would be a \"staggering\" amount of new cases over the next few days.", "On Wednesday a further 78,610 new cases were recorded, which is an increase of nearly 20,000 on Tuesday, and is around 10,000 more than the previous highest daily total, which came\u00a0in January during the second wave of the pandemic.", "Hospital admissions have also risen by 10.4 per cent up until Saturday, while deaths are down five per cent on the previous week, with a further 165 recorded on Wednesday.", "Dr Jenny Harries, the chief executive of the UK HSA, told a parliamentary committee earlier on Wednesday that the Omicron variant represents \"probably the most significant threat\" since the start of the pandemic early last year.", "While early indications show the severity of Omicron\u00a0may be less severe, the sheer number of cases could still overwhelm the country's health system, which Dr Harries said warned would potentially be in \"serious peril\".", "The Omicron variant has torn through Britain since the first case was identified at the end of November, and is on track to be the dominant variant in the country by the end of this week.", "The number of confirmed Omicron cases in the UK rose by 4,671 on Wednesday to bring the total to 10,017, which is an 87 per cent day-on-day rise.", "There has been one confirmed death from Omicron while there are at least 10 people in hospital with it.", "Prime Minister Boris Johnson's plan is to combat the variant with a booster jab program,\u00a0has seen the government pledge to offer all eligible adults a third dose by the end of the month.", "On Tuesday\u00a0there were 656,711 booster shots given in one day, a new record, but that figure will need to up that to around 1 million jabs a day to reach its ambitious target.", "More than 46 million people have had their second dose of the vaccine, or 81.5 per cent of the population, while more than 24 million have received a booster or third dose.", "England has also introduced COVID passes for nightclubs and high-capacity venues, as well as reintroducing mask-wearing and working from home in bit to slow the spread of the virus.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
